content: marella is a top-down vest with cables on the body it is a companion pattern to the ombrella sweater worked without the sleeves and with a split hem the cables on both designs are interchangeable and the patterns simple construction allow for easy modifications and full cable enjoyment **sizes ** 1 2 / 3 / 4 / 5 6 / 7 / 8 / 9 all measurements are those of the finished vest see last pictures for schematic and complete measurements finished bust circumference 86 94 / 106 / 114 / 126 138 / 146 / 154 / 162 cm 33 ¾ 37 / 41 ¾ / 44 ¾ / 49 ½ 54 ¼ / 57 ½ / 60 ¾ / 63 ¾ choose a size with about 5 cm 2 positive ease at bust shown in size 2 on a 88 cm 34 ¾ bust **yarn ** you will need 550 620 / 750 / 850 / 925 1075 / 1175 / 1275 / 1350 meters 605 680 / 820 / 930 / 1015 1175 / 1285 / 1395 / 1480 yards of dk weight yarn the sample is knit with les petites potions dk yack in terre brûlée **needles ** main fabric 4 mm us 6 circular needles with appropriate length to knit in the round and magic loop or dpns ribbing 3 5 mm us 4 circular needles with appropriate length to knit in the round and magic loop or dpns or size required to get gauge **gauge ** 20 sts x 29 rnds per 10 cm 4 with larger needles in stockinette after blocking 26 5 sts x 32 row per 10 cm 4 with larger needles in cable motif after blocking **notions ** stitch markers progress keeper recommended tapestry needle and scissors scrap yarn to place sts on hold cable needle row counters recommended **techniques used ** top down vest garter shoulders shaped with wrap & turn short row simple increases to shape the armholes cable panels on the front and back featuring twisted stitches and knit / purl cables over 4 and 12 sts twisted ribbing optional german short-row bust darts based on cup size split ribbed hem garter & 2/2 ribbing sleeve cuffs and collar texture is charted only ------------------------------------------------------------------- marella est un pull sans manches tricoté de haut en bas avec des torsades sur le corps il s agit d un patron accompagnant le pull ombrella travaillé sans les manches et avec un bas fendu les torsades sur les deux modèles sont interchangeables et la construction simple des pulls permettent des modifications simples et un tricot entièrement consacré au plaisir des torsades **tailles ** 1 2 / 3 / 4 / 5 6 / 7 / 8 / 9 toutes les mesures sont celles du pull fini voir dernières photos pour le schéma technique et toutes les mesures tour de buste du pull 86 94 / 106 / 114 / 126 138 / 146 / 154 / 162 cm choisissez une taille
